episodes.title: The Mysterious Visit
episodes.description: Helen Stoner arrives at Sherlock Holmes' office early in the morning, seeking help to investigate her twin sister Julia's mysterious death two years ago. Helen fears her violent stepfather, Dr. Grimsby Roylott. She recounts how Julia had gotten engaged and started hearing a low whistle and a crackling sound at night. One night, Julia screamed, ran to Helen's room, collapsed, and died after saying the word 'stained string'. Now, with her own room under repair, Helen has moved into Julia's old room and hears the same whistle at night.

evidence_collected.description: Detailed account of Julia's death and strange occurrences in her own room.

episodes.title: A Threatening Encounter
episodes.description: Shortly after Helen leaves, Dr. Grimsby Roylott storms into Holmes' office. He threatens Holmes and Watson, demonstrating his strength by bending a fireplace poker, warning them to stay out of his affairs.

episodes.title: Financial Motives Uncovered
episodes.description: Holmes and Watson travel to Stoke Moran to investigate further. They stop by the registry office to learn about the Stoner family's financial situation and discover that Roylott has a motive to prevent Helen and Julia from marrying.

episodes.title: Clues in Julia's Room
episodes.description: At Stoke Moran, Holmes and Watson examine Julia's room, now occupied by Helen. They find a vent connecting to Dr. Roylott's room, a bell pull that doesn't function, and a bed fixed to the floor.

episodes.title: Strange Findings in Dr. Roylott's Room
episodes.description: Holmes and Watson then inspect Dr. Roylott’s room. They find a large safe, a saucer of milk, and a leash-like object.

evidence_collected.description: Indicating the presence of an animal.

episodes.title: The Deadly Night
episodes.description: Holmes and Watson wait in Julia's room at night. They hear a low whistle, and Holmes strikes the bell pull with a cane. A metallic sound follows from Dr. Roylott's room. The snake, enraged by Holmes' attack, returns to Dr. Roylott and bites him. Roylott dies instantly from the venom.

evidence_collected.description: Indicating the snake’s summoning and retrieval.

episodes.title: The Final Explanation
episodes.description: Back at 221B Baker Street, Holmes explains the case to Watson. He reveals how Dr. Roylott trained the snake to kill Julia and attempted the same with Helen. The motive was to retain control of the inheritance.

culprit_details.name: Dr. Grimsby Roylott
culprit_details.motive: Prevent stepdaughters from marrying to retain their inheritance
